Package com.ecrowson.Chess

Class Tile

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
com.ecrowson.Chess.Tile
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class Tile extends javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
A tile on the chess board. Allows for pieces to be set on a tile and for the board to have visual changes.
Author:
Ethan Crowson

    Methods inherited from interface javafx.css.Styleable

    getStyleableNode

  • Constructor Details

    • Tile

      public Tile(Boolean isLight, int x, int y)
      Constructs a new Tile.
      Parameters:
      isLight - a boolean specifying if the tile is light or dark as seen on a chess board.
      x - the x value of the tile (The file in chess terminology).
      y - the y value of the tile (The rank in chess terminilogy).

  • Method Details

    • isOccupied

      public boolean isOccupied()
      Checks if the current tile withholds a piece.
      Returns:
      if the piece value of the tile is null.

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece()
      Getter method for the piece in the tile.
      Returns:
      the piece stored in this tile.

    • setPiece

      public void setPiece(Piece piece)
      Setter method for the piece in the tile. Adds the corresponding image of the piece to the board.
      Parameters:
      piece - the piece to be set to the tile.

    • removePiece

      public void removePiece()
      Remove the piece from the tile and sets the piece value to null.

    • selected

      public void selected()
      Colours the tile to indicate that it has been selected. Different colours if the tile is light or dark.

    • deselect

      public void deselect()
      Restores the tile's default colours after being unselected.

    • setHighlight

      public void setHighlight(String highlight)
      Sets the highlights of the tile. Including dots for possible movement and outlines for possible takes.
      Parameters:
      highlight - the string corresponding to the chosen highlight.

    • removeHighlight

      public void removeHighlight()
      Removes the highlights from the tile.

    • occupiedTakeable

      public boolean occupiedTakeable(Piece oPiece)
      Checks if the tile is occupied and takeable given another piece.
      Parameters:
      oPiece - the piece attacking this tile.
      Returns:
      if there is a piece on this tile that is takeable.

    • inCheck

      public void inCheck()
      Sets the colour of the tile if the king is in check.

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Getter method for the x value of the tile.
      Returns:
      value of x.

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Getter method for the y value of the tile.
      Returns:
      value of y.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the tile in the form of the x and y values of the tile.
      Overrides:
      toString in class javafx.scene.Node
      Returns:
      string representation of the tile.

    • getHighlight

      public boolean getHighlight()
      Getter method of the boolean storing if the tile is highlighted.
      Returns:
      if the tile is currently highlighted.
